metadata.title: CVE-2004-2771 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
The expand function in fio.c in Heirloom mailx 12.5 and earlier and BSDmailx 8.1.2 and earlier allows remote attackers to execute arbitrarycommands via shell metacharacters in an email address.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2004-2771` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

bsd-mailx - 8.1.2-0.20040524cvs-2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: bsd-mailx package in esm-infra/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '8.1.2-0.20040524cvs-2').
